general.title: Wiki-Bot Settings
general.welcome:
Welcome to the Wiki-Bot Dashboard.

Wiki-Bot is a Discord bot made to bring Discord servers and MediaWiki wikis together. It helps with linking wiki pages, verifying wiki users, informing about latest changes on the wiki and more. [More information]

Here you can change different bot settings for servers you have Manage Server permission on. To begin, you will have to authenticate your Discord account which you can do with this button:

invalid.note_http: The provided website doesn't use HTTPS!
invalid.note_timeout: The provided link took too long to respond!
invalid.text: The URL couldn't be resolved to a valid MediaWiki site!
invalid.title: Invalid wiki!

outdated.text: The recent changes webhook requires at least MediaWiki 1.30!
outdated.title: Outdated MediaWiki version!

prefix.space: The prefix may not include spaces!

sysmessage.text: The page $1 needs to match the server id $2.

rcscript.desc: These are the recent changes webhooks for $1:
rcscript.explanation:
Recent Changes Webhook

Wiki-Bot is able to run a recent changes webhook based on RcGcDw. The recent changes can be displayed in compact text messages with inline links or embed messages with edit tags and category changes.

Requirements to add a recent changes webhook:

  • The wiki needs to run on MediaWiki 1.30 or higher.
  • The system message MediaWiki:Custom-RcGcDw needs to be set to the Discord server id .

form.confirm: Do you really want to delete the recent changes webhook?
form.display_compact: Compact text messages with inline links.
form.display_diff: Embed messages with image previews and edit differences.
form.display_embed: Embed messages with edit tags and category changes.

selector.desc: This is a list of all servers you can change settings on because you have the [Manage Server]($1) permission. Please select a server:
selector.invite: Wiki-Bot is not a member of $1 yet, but you can [invite Wiki-Bot]($2).
selector.none: You currently don't have the [Manage Server]($1) permission on any servers, are you logged into the correct account?
selector.title: Server Selector

form.confirm: Do you really want to delete the channel overwrite?

verification.explanation:
User Verification

Using the verify <wiki username> command, users are able to verify themselves as a specific wiki user by using the Discord field on their wiki profile. If the user matches and user verifications are set up on the server, Wiki-Bot will give them the roles for all verification entries they matched.

Every verification entry allows for multiple restrictions on when a user should match the verification:

  • Channel to use the verify command in.
  • Role to get when matching the verification entry.
  • Required edit count on the wiki to match the verification entry.
  • Required user group to be a member of on the wiki to match the verification entry.
  • Required account age in days to match the verification entry.
  • Whether the Discord users nickname should be set to their wiki username when they match the verification entry.

form.confirm: Do you really want to delete the verification?
form.postcount_and: Require both edit and post count.
form.postcount_both: Require combined edit and post count.
form.postcount_or: Require either edit or post count.
